text.section: One (1) year from the date of a revocation, any former licensee whose license has been revoked may petition the department for reinstatement. The department shall investigate the petition and may reinstate the license upon a finding that the applicant has complied with any terms prescribed by the department and is again able to competently engage in the practice of performing electrical work.

At any time during the investigative or hearing processes, the department may enter into an agreed order or accept an assurance of voluntary compliance with the license holder which effectively deals with the complaint.
The department may reconsider, modify, or reverse its probations, suspensions, or other disciplinary actions.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 437, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 119, sec. 11, effective June 24, 2003.
